title: bench: core.encode/decode
body:
Benches for #13749

M1 baseline:
```
test bench_utf8_decode_12_b  ... bench:         204 ns/iter (+/- 13)
test bench_utf8_decode_12_kb ... bench:       3,189 ns/iter (+/- 1,049)
test bench_utf8_decode_12_mb ... bench:   1,430,887 ns/iter (+/- 29,186)
test bench_utf8_encode_12_b  ... bench:         433 ns/iter (+/- 13)
test bench_utf8_encode_12_kb ... bench:       5,786 ns/iter (+/- 693)
test bench_utf8_encode_12_mb ... bench:   4,946,268 ns/iter (+/- 118,515)
```

title: refactor: remove dead code from lsp
body: In #12968 `#[allow(unused)]` was added, but never removed.  Since then there is a significant amount of dead code and other things that have creeped into the whole of the lsp.  This PR cleans all that up.

title: feat(ext/net): support cert, key options in listenTls
body:
This PR adds `cert: string` and `key: string` options to `Deno.listenTls` and deprecates `certFile` and `keyFile` options.

You can specify the cert and private key from any source now. The read permission is checked only when `certFile` or `keyFile` is specified

closes #12639

title: feat: allow specification of import map in config file
body: Closes: #12800

title: chore: use rustfmt cli via dprint for faster format
body:
This PR uses dprint to orchestrate formatting via rustfmt.

Before: 6384ms
After: 932ms (3677ms on the first format or with incremental disabled)

I think part of the previous ~2.5 slowdown was from collecting the file paths. Dprint's CLI has a super fast custom glob walking solution.

title: fix: move the permission check at the beginning of the upgrade process
docs: add description + code example to `structuredClone`, `CompressionStream`, `DecompressionStream`
body:
Also this updates some more jsdoc that is not rendering well on hover in VS Code.

The compression examples are from the 1.19 release notes, thought it would be nice to add them in

title: chore: bump nix to 0.23
body:
As advised by `cargo audit`

```
$ cargo audit
Crate:         nix
Version:       0.22.1
Title:         Out-of-bounds write in nix::unistd::getgrouplist
Date:          2021-09-27
ID:            RUSTSEC-2021-0119
URL:           https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2021-0119
Solution:      Upgrade to ^0.20.2 OR ^0.21.2 OR ^0.22.2 OR >=0.23.0
Dependency tree:
nix 0.22.1
├── rustyline 9.0.0
│   └── deno 1.19.0
├── deno_runtime 0.45.0
│   └── deno 1.19.0
└── deno 1.19.0
```

I think we should also add a `actions-rs/audit-check` job in the CI workflow

title: chore: update wpt
feat(test): improved op sanitizer errors + traces
body:
This commit improves the error messages for the `deno test` async op
sanitizer. It does this in two ways:
- it uses handwritten error messages for each op that could be leaking
- it includes traces showing where each op was started

This "async op tracing" functionality is a new feature in deno_core.
It likely has a significant performance impact, which is why it is only
enabled in tests.

title: feat: deno vendor
body:
Not part of this first pass:

- Warning when dynamic import is not statically analyzable (https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/issues/138)
- Special handling of file system layout to take into account Window's 260 character path limit. I had some code that handled this, but it wasn't very good and I thought of a better solution. I'll open an issue and do another PR at a later time.
- Module specifiers with different text in the same module that resolve to the same module aren't handled (https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/issues/132) -- Not a big deal because this is probably super rare
- Directories with different casing resolve to the same folder on case insensistive file systems. I will have an upcomming PR with the 260 char limit that fixes this (just added this to dnt [here](https://github.com/denoland/dnt/pull/125))
- The specified import map is not combined with the generated import map. It might be hard to do this correctly because the base of the import map changes when going into the vendor folder. Right now it's not a big deal for people to manually update the created import map after.

Differences with proposal:

- Uses `vendor` folder instead of `_vendor` by default (seemed like in the meeting people wanted `vendor` instead?).
- Output is not dependent on the existing state of the vendor folder.
  - Errors when the vendor folder exists and is non-empty. Allows using a `--force` flag to potentially overwrite the contents.
  - No `--info` flag
  - Specifying an import map via `--import-map ...` located within the output directory will error.
  -  Why: Vendor is already a complex feature and I think basing the vendor output on the existing state of the vendor folder would be very difficult to do. It would also be hard to fix bugs because we'd need to know the previous state of the vendor folder. I think it also might be difficult for some users to understand.

Closes #13346

title: fix(ext/crypto): optional additionalData in encrypt/decrypt
body:
Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13525

Was failing earlier because `undefined` is not `None` with serde (for `Option<Vec<u8>>`). This patch passes an empty buf to the op.

title: chore(ext/timers): Move ext/timers to ext/web
body: Needed for #13582.

title: feat(ext/ffi): Support read only statics
body:
This PR introduces support for read only statics binding in Deno FFI. The API is added within the existing unstable FFI symbols definition while staying backwards compatible with existing FFI definitions. This means that the API is perhaps a bit confused:

```ts
const dylib = Deno.dlopen(libPath, {
  "printSomething": {
    name: "print_something",
    parameters: [],
    result: "void",
  },
  "static_u32": {
    name: "static_u32",
    type: "u32",
  },
});
```

Statics explicitly define their type, whereas functions just barge in with their definitions just as before. This also means that the serde type for the `HashMap` that is symbols in `op_ffi_load` needs to use an untagged enum.

### Testing
* A few basic tests are added
  * u32 static
  * pointer static

### TypeScript bindings
* The bindings for the FFI API have been updated to include the possibility of native values, but have not been tested for correctness.

### Future work
Mutable statics are not supported by this PR. I see the way forward with those being an optional `mutable` flag on the static definition. If the flag is set set, then the API would use a getter and setter for the value instead of the current fetch-and-cache-once logic.

Additionally, at present the bindings do not support null symbols. This is (I presume) a reasonable choice since an immutable static symbol with a null value is forever just a null value. With mutable statics a null symbol might become more relevant, at which point it will become necessary to do something like in https://docs.rs/dlopen/latest/dlopen/raw/struct.Library.html#example-1. Allowing null symbols might also be put behind a flag if so desired. That would allow for cleaner TS typings.

Closes #13570

title: compat: support --compat in web workers
body:
Adds another callback to `WebWorkerOptions` that allows to execute
some modules before actual worker code executes. This allows to set up Node
global using `std/node`.

title: feat(ext/http): add support for unix domain sockets
body: This adds support for unix domain sockets in ext/http (#13626). The primary change is replace `std::net::SocketAddr` with a custom enum so we can store the address of a unix domain socket. I have to make this type `pub` in order to refer to it in runtime/ops/http.rs .

title: feat(lsp): provide completions from import map if available
body:
Closes #13619

(This also updates to import_map v0.8.0)

title: feat(runtime): web streams in fs & net APIs
body:
This commit adds `readable` and `writable` properties to `Deno.File` and
`Deno.Conn`. This makes it very simple to use files and network sockets
with fetch or the native HTTP server.

Closes #13614

something other than a BufferSource to a (De)CompressionStream. The
WPT tests already pass, because they just check for error type
(TypeError), and not error message. A TypeError was already thrown for
invalid values via serde_v8.

title: chore: release crates for v1.18.2
fix: don't crash when $HOME is a relative path
body:
Canonicalize the cache/home dir before use in DenoDir.

Fixes #13561

title: feat(lsp): add redirect diagnostic and quick fix
body:
Ref: #12864

This is a more general solution to #12864, which I think I like better.  It also "works" for pinning URLs with the Deno warnings like `deno.land/x` and `deno.land/std`.

Basically if a specifier is redirected, a quick fix will be available to replace the import with the redirected URL.  For example:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1282577/152283410-ff95954d-b2ca-4a93-8f04-e623e2e50ffa.mp4

title: refactor(lsp): remove circular dependency between `LanguageServer` and `DiagnosticsServer`
body:
Was looking through the code for more deadlocks and did some refactoring to remove the circular dependency between `LanguageServer` and `DiagnoticsServer`. To be clear, I don't see any deadlock potential in this code, but removing the circular dependency will reduce the chance of code changes in the future causing a deadlock.

The circular dependency is removed by the language server sending a snapshot to the diagnostics server when causing a diagnostics update.

The best way to deal with this was to refactor out the metadata to a seperate structure.  It makes extending this a lot easier in the future (specifically adding #12864 in a follow-up PR).

There is no new test, because I changed the test_util server to behave more like we see in practice, which broke the existing test, which then the PR fixes.

title: example(core): Add example for TypeScript transpiling via deno_ast
body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

title: refactor: update runtime code for primordial check for iterators
body: Fixes errors pointed out by https://github.com/denoland/deno_lint/pull/995

title: Revert "error on warnings (#13344)"
body:
The reverted PR had the unintentional side effect of disabling static linking on Windows.
See https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13471.

This reverts commit 79b698f88b5f8e247df7280ccb52c2a8271a426c.

title: refactor: factor out CDP message types
refactor: update runtime code for primordial checks for "instanceof"
body:
Errors surfaced with https://github.com/denoland/deno_lint/pull/992

Closes #13255

title: feat(unstable): add Deno.getUid
body: closes #13493

title: refactor: integrate deno_graph 0.20.0
body: Down to 53 errors... just a chore to get the rest of them...

title: docs: fix markdown error in sleepSync jsdoc
body: sleepSync jsdoc has an error in markdown syntax. This affects the rendered doc in doc.deno.land https://doc.deno.land/deno/unstable/~/Deno.sleepSync

title: refactor(lsp): remove RwLock on `Config`
body:
1. Removes the RwLock on `Config` so the config state is behind the same lsp mutex as mostly everything else
2. Removes the occurence of calling back to the client while holding onto the LSP mutex's lock (potential deadlocking scenario based on how the client is implemented).

Maybe fixes #13477.

title: fix(lsp): independent diagnostic publishing should include all diagnostic sources on each publish
body:
Previously I must have accidentally tested the wrong binary in the editor and forgot that each publish needs to include the diagnostics from all sources (instead of the client figuring that out). I've fixed the tests now to properly only select the last messages sent for each specifier and it gets the diagnostics for that.

Also fixes some flaky tests caused by it now being done in parallel.

title: refactor(lsp): Documents - combine duplicate exists methods
body: `Document.exists` was added in #13473, but we already have a method for doing this. This changes combines the two methods and uses the new functionality.

title: tests: Add inspector tests for "Memory" and "Profile" tabs
body: Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13244

title: feat(unstable): add Deno.networkInterfaces
body:
This PR adds an unstable new API `Deno.networkInterfaces` which returns an array of network interface informations.

closes #8137

title: perf(lsp): improve some tsc op hot paths
body: Chasing down another issues I realised that while individual `op_exists` and `op_script_version` are not performance issues themselves, they are often called 1000s of time per document and we should really try to be as efficient with them as possible.

title: fix(lsp): respect DENO_CERT and other options related to TLS certs
body:
Fixes #13437

The LSP now respects `DENO_CERT` and `DENO_TLS_CA_STORE` for registry suggestions and caching remote modules.

This also adds the options to the configuration of the LSP:

- `tlsCertificate` - this mirrors the `--cert` option (and overrides the `DENO_CERT` environment variable)
- `certificateStores` - this overrides the `DENO_TLS_CA_STORE` enviornment variable.
- `unsafelyIgnoreCertificateErrors` - this mirrors the `--unsafely-ignore-certificate-errors` command line option.

It extracts the creation logic for `RootCertStore` which is used by the file fetcher to the file fetcher which is now shared between `ProcState` and the lsp.

title: fix(ext/crypto): duplicate RsaHashedImportParams types
body:
Can be observed here: https://doc.deno.land/deno/stable/~/RsaHashedImportParams
It did not break `importKey` and wasn't detected by our tests because the right definition was inferred as [HmacImportParams](https://doc.deno.land/deno/stable/~/HmacImportParams) 

(i wish lint could complaint about overriding fields in duplicate definitions)

title: refactor(core): Extract poll_value out of resolve_value
body:
This is similar to run_event_loop X poll_event_loop. The reason for
this is that the future returned by resolve_value has the same
lifetime as the runtime. That is fine when rust can reason about it,
but in some cases it can't.

In the particular case we have, our runtime, which includes a
JsRuntime, is stored in a Rc<RefCell<...>>. With this change we can
easily poll to see if a value has been fulfilled.

title: chore: upgrade to rust 1.58.1
body:
Due to [Race condition in std::fs::remove_dir_all](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/security/advisories/GHSA-r9cc-f5pr-p3j2)

Also adds a `rust-toolchain`
